Announcement: -Adult Nephrology Fellowship program

The department of internal medicine, SPHMMC, kindly invites all qualified and competent applicants to apply for the fellowship program in adult nephrology
Admission requirements:
The candidate should fulfill the following requirements
1. Must have a doctor of medicine from a recognized medical school. 
2. Completed residency program in internal medicine from a recognized medical school
3. Served at least two years as an internist 
4. Must complete the screening process for admission to be undertaken by the department of internal medicine including the entrance examination
5. Registered and licensed to practice internal medicine in Ethiopia by the relevant authorities
6. Should have adequate physical and mental health to deliver both his/her academic and clinical service responsibilities
7. Must pass graduate admission test (GAT) administered by MOE
Applicants should write a brief letter of intent describing 
â€¢ Their interest in the fellowship and their expectations
â€¢ Where they would serve as a nephrologist and their plans after they complete the fellowship
Applicants should submit the following documents:
â€¢ Application letter
â€¢ Updated CV 
â€¢ Copy of credentials: degrees/student copy
â€¢ Two letters of recommendation preferably via email
â€¢ Letter of sponsorship from sponsoring institution (not applicable for private/self-sponsoring applicants)
Interested applicants can apply in person to the department of internal medicine or use the following email addresses:
hamelmal.gebeyahu@sphmmc.edu.et 
lejahamza@yahoo.com 
lina.mohammed@sphmmc.edu.et 
Available spots: 3
Application deadline:  September 15, 2023
Entrance exam and Interview of candidates: To be specified

Announcement -Adult Cardiology Fellowship program

The department of internal medicine, SPHMMC, kindly invites all qualified and competent applicants to apply for fellowship program in adult cardiology.

Admission requirements:
1. The candidate must have doctor of medicine from a recognized medical school. 
2. Completed residency program in internal medicine from a recognized medical school.
3. Served at least for two years 
4. Must complete screening process for admission to be undertaken by the department of internal medicine including entrance examination. 
5. Registered and licensed to practice internal medicine in Ethiopia by the relevant authorities. 
6. Should have adequate physical and mental health to deliver both his/her academic and clinical service responsibilities.

7. Must pass Graduate Admission Test (GAT) administered by MOE

Applicants should write a brief letter of intent describing their interest in the fellowship, expectations and impact on their career after joining the program. 

Applicants should submit the following documents.
 Application letterïƒ¼
 Recent CV with intent letterïƒ¼
 Copy of credentials including degrees, student copyïƒ¼
 Two letters of recommendation in a sealed envelopeïƒ¼
 Letter of sponsorship from sponsoring institutionïƒ¼

Interested applicants can apply in person to SPHMMC registrar office or the department of internal medicine or use registrar@sphmmc.edu.et  to send scanned copy. 

Available spots- 3
Application deadline: September 5, 2023. 

NB: The early application date is needed to give candidates adequate time to take GAT exam. Entrance exam and Interview of the short listed candidates will be conducted at the end of November 2023. Specific dates to be announced in the future.

Ultrasound of Uterine duplication anomalies in 2D & 3D.
.
Special Thanks to our great teacher, Prof. Dr. Rasha Kamal.
.
How to diagnose Uterine duplication anomalies with 2D ultrasound :
The 1st step is to detect the duplicated endometrial cavity.
_ Better to be assessed on the 2nd half of the cycle (luteal phase / homogenous hyperechoic endometrial lining).
The 2nd step is to comment on the outer contour of the myometrium (circumferential outline on axial images).
If smooth non indented outer contour then :
*** Arcuate uterus (duplication runs for short segment) vs
*** Subseptate uterus (duplication runs for longer segment) vs
*** Septate uterus ( (duplication extends to the cervix).
The 3rd step if indented myometrial contour or separated two separated uterine horns, then comment on the Symmetry of the uterine horns :
***  Unicornuate uterus with rudimentary horn (two Asymmetrical uterine horns).
*** Bicornuate uterus ((two Symmetrical uterine horns - usually closely separated - single cervix).
*** Didelphys uterus (two Symmetrical uterine horns - widely separated - two cervices).
.
#IsmailRadiologyNotes
Evaluating high risk Vs low risk scars by ultrasound i.e risk of ruptures during trial of labor (VBAC)

PLACENTA GRADING

GRADE-O 
 (14-32weeks) The  placenta  lies  in  Grade  O  from  14  up  to  32  of  pregnancy.  In  this  Grade placenta  will  homogenous  from  one  end  to  the  other  end.  The  outer  surface  which is  chorionic  plate  appears  echogenic.in  this  stage  the  attachment  of  the  placenta  to the uterine  wall  is  very  strong  because the  fetus  at  this  stage needs  maximum  blood supply. 

 GRADE-1 
(32-34weeks) The placenta  lies  in  Grade-I,  from  32  to  34  weeks  of  pregnancy  this  is characterized  by  indentation/hollows  of  the  chorionic plate  and  small  intervals.

 GRADE-II 
(  34-36weeks) The  placenta  lies  in  this  grade  from  34  to  36  weeks,  and  it  is  characterized  by holes  formation  and  placenta  divided  in  to  4-8  segments/parts.  Now  the  placental attachment  to  the uterine wall  becomes  weak. 

 GRADE-III
 After  36  weeks  many  changes  takes  place  in  the  placenta.  At  this  stage the  placenta will  seen  in  4-8  separate  segments.  The  attachment  of  the  placenta  to  the  uterine wall  becomes  weaker  and  the  blood  supply  to  the  fetus  also  decreases.                    And  this  is  known  as  Grade-III maturation  of  placenta.
